intro: Oenothera torulosa proles helianthemiflora, commonly known as the helianthemum evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Onagraceae family, with ornamental and ecological value in native gardens.
